definition: ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: Hershey's Shelf Stable Milk is a Grade A milk procured from local family-owned dairies.
sentences.chinese: “好時”耐儲存牛奶是從本地奶牛場採購的A級牛奶。

sentences.english: The cow cockies , as these farmers are known, own shares in Fonterra based on their milk production.
sentences.chinese: 這些奶牛場按照牛奶的產量持有恆天然公司的股份。

sentences.english: I was raised on a dairy farm. I milked cows.
sentences.chinese: 我是在一個奶牛場長大的，我曾經擠牛奶。

sentences.english: Whenever this happened the dairy was paralyzed.
sentences.chinese: 只要出現了這種事，奶牛場就癱瘓了。

sentences.english: There was once a dairy farm on the Biltmore estate.
sentences.chinese: 有一次在比爾特莫爾房地產奶牛場。

sentences.english: Not a human being was out of doors at the dairy.
sentences.chinese: 奶牛場上，門外看不見一個人。
